clinical_study.brief_title: Special Drug Use Investigation for PAXIL Tablet (Investigation in Case of Administered From 20mg/Day)
clinical_study.official_title: Special Drug Use Investigation for PAXIL Tablet (Investigation in Case of Administered From 20mg/Day)

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this survey was to understand the safety and efficacy of PAXIL tablets ("PAXIL", hereinafter) when it was started at 20 mg/day in subjects with depression or in a depressed state.

primary_outcome.description: Incidence of adverse events in Japanese subjects treated with paroxetine tablet based on prescribing information under the conditions of general clinical practice

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy evaluation based on overall improvement
primary_outcome.description: The investigator compared the general condition over 1 week before each clinical visit with that over 1 week before the start of treatment with PAXIL.

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy evaluation based on severity by symptoms
primary_outcome.description: At every clinical visit, the investigator rated each of the specified symptoms including depressed mood, loss of interests/concerns, anxiety, lack of motivation, physical symptoms, and sleep disorders.

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy evaluation based on Beck Depression Inventory- Second Edition (BDI-II)
primary_outcome.description: The investigator asked each subject to fill out the self-administered form of BDI-II at every clinical visit (recommended clinical visit schedule: 1, 2, 4, 8, and 12 weeks after the start of treatment).

arm_group.description: Patients with depression or in a depressed state starting PAXIL at 20 mg/day during study period

study_pop.textblock: Japanese subjects with depression or in a depressed state who are considered appropriate to prescribe paroxetine tablet starting at 20mg/day according to the prescribing information

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with depression or in a depressed state
- Patients who start taking paroxetine at 20mg a day
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have been treated with paroxetine prior to this investigation
- Patients with hypersensitivity to paroxetine
- Patients taking monoamine oxidase inhibitors (MAOIs) or within 2 weeks of stopping treatment with MAOIs
- Concomitant use in patients taking pimozide
